intro: Borreria tonalensis, commonly known as Mexican false indigo, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale blue, attracting various pollinators. Borreria tonalensis is often found in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. It is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value and has traditional uses in some indigenous cultures.
